nodes.text: Cepa Bonshu was a communications artist from the planet Riosa who was responsible for the creation of the art piece What Will You Do, which protested the Galactic Empire's use of forced conscription into their military on some worlds. The piece used the Sith Lord Darth Vader as a central element as he had overseen the subjugation of Riosa and the impressment of its population into labor camps. By the time of the Hosnian Cataclysm many years later, Bonshu had retired after a long arts career and began teaching at the Ord Canfre Institute for Ethics in Art Criticism.
Cepa Bonshu was first mentioned in the reference book Star Wars Propaganda: A History of Persuasive Art in the Galaxy, which was written by Pablo Hidalgo and released on October 25, 2016.
